Tropical Snow Hawaiian Ice And Food Concession

craft_vendors.title: Natural Adornment By Elena Mc Cabe

performances.title: Alexander Bradshaw Band
performances.long_description: Upstate Performer/Singer/Songwriter who is in the middle of writing and recording their first solo album

performances.title: The Oxtet
performances.description: jazz quintet, of drums, bass, vibes, trumpet, and keyboards
performances.long_description: osh Oxford graduated in 2007 with a degree in percussion performance from Ithaca College. Seeking an outlet for his keyboard playing and love of vintage keyboards and synthesizers, Josh started a jazz quintet, consisting of drums, bass, vibes, trumpet, and Oxford on keyboards. The OXtet quickly evolved into something far more devious than simply playing jazz standards. Over the years guitar and sax was added to fill out the ensemble and create the unique blend of acoustic and electronic instruments. The music takes from the rhythmic complexities inherent in the music of Frank Zappa and the Mahavishnu Orchestra; the funk aspects of 80s Miles Davis; and compositional techniques used in modern classical music, such as atonality and 12-Tone serialism. The ensemble mainly uses Ithaca College students to perform the music, after Josh‚Äôs tragic car accident. Occasionally the original group will perform in the Ithaca area.

performances.title: Janet Batch
performances.long_description: Janet Batch is a singer songwriter who resides in the Finger Lakes Region of central New York State.¬† Her first album, ‚ÄúA Good Woman is Hard to Find‚Äù has garnered her praise from country/folk fans and connoisseurs alike.¬† Janet's musical style has been referred to as "country with an art degree" and she has been endeared as "the voice of the hills".¬† One part Stevie Nicks, two parts Johnny Cash, she sings, unabashed, of death, romance, and the wondering of what went wrong.¬† Her songs are an illustration of the pendulum that swings between joy and heartache.

performances.title: Bronwen Exter
performances.long_description: Turns out, moving home is complicated. You bring along what you hoped to leave behind, and don‚Äôt necessarily find what you remembered best about a place. The granddaughter of a Ukrainian communist, a Disneyland-tire maker, an Yves St. Laurent wedding dress model and the Chief Statistician for President Lyndon Johnson, Exter‚Äôs life has always been filled with stories and characters. At the age of six, from her bedroom in rural upstate New York, she recorded her first songs. She remembers the bright, grass-green carpet scrap and the old tape-recorder sitting on it. They were mostly songs about cowgirls.

performances.title: The Analogue Sons
performances.long_description:
Lee Hamilton - saxophones (orig. JBB, Tribulations, JATAS, Super 20)

Michael Stark - organ, bass, synth (JATAS, TZAR, Super 20, MSZM, Wingnut & more) Lars Burggren - drumkit (JATAS, Gunpoets) Aaron Speiser - dubs, melodica (JATAS)

performances.title: ¬°Viva Mayhem!
performances.long_description: ¬°Viva Mayhem! invites you to dance, sing, and wear your heart on your sleeve. An eight-piece post-wave ska band out of Ithaca, NY, ¬°VM! has a stellar female lead, a rockin' rhythm section and a tight hornline. Together, their sound is raw, original, and true.

performances.title: Road Man
performances.long_description: Jon Petronzio displays a deep understanding of the soul of music. With hooks that get stuck in your head and bounce around for days, to lyrics that make you think or make you smile, "Light At the Speed of Life" is one of those collections that prove the album format is not only not dead, but has as much meaning today as it ever did. From the upbeat, roots-style "Who Do You Love" to the darker message of "Mankind Suicide" to the love-lost lament of "Crying For So Long", these songs run the gammut of human experience, and put Road Man squarely on the map of relevant, meaningful and downright good-to-listen-to music.

performances.title: Gunpoets
performances.description: Voice as a weapon, words as bullets, spreading the universal message of peace, love, and justice through music.

performances.title: Arthur B and the Planetary Mix
performances.description: elestial grooves for the celebration of life!
performances.long_description: Arthur B and The Planetary Mix is a modern R n B influenced group, bringing on stellar sounds framed in an old school style. With original songs that are at once fresh and new, but also timeless and classic, this is music to dance to, sing with, and celebrate life. The band's live performances have been described as "A rare treat" and "Pure soul healing". Their much anticipated debut CD will be released in early 2019.

performances.title: Vitamin L
performances.long_description: The purpose of the Vitamin L project is to spread love and goodwill through music... to uplift and inspire young people and encourage positive character development, through music. The objective is that the listeners will absorb the ideas we present and integrate them so that these ideas can help them make healthy choices and have healthy relationships with themselves and others. Our mission is to reach and positively influence as many children as possible.

performances.title: Seishi Karate
performances.long_description: Seishi Juku training is safe, most effective and fun. This "Legendary " Martial Art Discipline is practiced seriously, recognized locally and worldwide.

performances.title: Palleon
performances.long_description: From Trumansburg, NY, the birthplace of Robert Moog's first modular synthesizer, comes Chris Ploss' "Palleon"

performances.title: Vee Da Bee
performances.description: melodic guitar work with eclectic percussive elements
performances.long_description: Vee Da Bee is a pseudonym for Victoria DeBerry, who moved up to Ithaca, NY from Houston, TX to pursue a degree in Communications. She got swept up in the beauty of the Finger Lakes and planted her roots. She started as a solo act in 2016, and eventually met Paul (bass) and Chris (drums/percussion) who make up the band.

performances.title: Wassa Pan Afrika Dance Ensemble
performances.long_description: Wassa Pan Afrika Dance Ensemble was founded by Nana Kwasi Anim, and is known as the most premiere traditional African Dance and Drum performance group throughout Ghana, West Africa.¬† Several members trained at the Pan Africa Orchestra, the Center for National Culture, Ghana Cultural Ballet, and the Dance Factory.¬† They are considered the most elite group of musicians and dancers, and students and audiences have traveled from all over the world to train with them.

performances.title: Josh Oxford CD Release
performances.long_description: Electronisist Josh Oxford, born in 1985, is a composer, arranger, and performer of myriad styles of music. Using his collection of vintage synthesizers, Josh is the leader of ‚ÄúThe OXtet,‚Äù a jazz fusion ensemble for which Oxford composes all the music. He has performed throughout the country, especially in his native central New York, on piano, percussion, and Moog synthesizer.

performances.title: Kurt Riley
performances.long_description: Born an Army brat, Kurt Riley has been on the road all his life. Relocating from state to state often as a boy, he turned to art and fiction as solace from the loneliness that life granted. Stemming from a conservative upbringing, he sought an escape from that stifling mindset; the exodus was granted at fourteen years old, when he discovered The Rolling Stones. Further galvanized by Delta blues, Chess Records, and classic R&B, Riley taught himself how to sing and play both the guitar and harmonica a year later. Subsequently, enthralled by Fifties rock and roll and the brilliant groups of the British Invasion, he began composing original songs of his own in earnest. Along the way, he added piano, synthesizer, drums, maracas, castanets, tambourine, bass guitar and slide guitar to his palette, composing increasingly melodic, richly interwoven pop songs. Riley's influences grew to include glam rock, Moroccan ritual music, new wave, 1930s pop standards, and Eighties post-punk. All of these and more informed a rich, diverse style of songwriting, which combines disparate elements in new ways while preserving the rockabilly energy and Delta blues grit that first inspired him in the first place.

performances.title: The Blind Spots
performances.description: ll original, female-fronted, five-piece moxy rock band
performances.long_description: The Blind Spots, a tenured, original, five-piece moxy rock band steered by magnetic songstress and force of nature Maddy Walsh (think Heart; think Janis; think Adele and Blondie and Joan Jett and Talking Heads all rolled into one), recently celebrated its ten-year "bandiversary" with a sold-out show at Ithaca, NY's Hangar Theatre. The event was paired with the release of the band's fourth studio album, Talk, which they have been actively touring the country in support of. The new album brings to the stage a wide range of emotions and a matured grasp of songwriting, paired, as always, with the band's signature high-energy performances and incessant penchant for FUN.

performances.title: Alan Rose and Restless Elements
performances.long_description: A quick list of influences combines names you‚Äôll recognize like Springsteen, Costello, and Simon and Garfunkel with names you might not, like Crenshaw, Bragg, and Whiskeytown. Years of record collecting, including stints as a reviewer for Webster‚Äôs Weekly (one of the first web-only periodicals) and as a writer for 14850.com magazine, have given him a depth of musical knowledge and a taste for the obscure. All of this listening has helped Alan develop a talent for turning universal emotions into memorable lyrics. Combine that with an ear for marrying those lyrics to hook-filled memories and you have songs that engage listeners on multiple levels.

performances.title: Answer the Muse
performances.long_description: Answer the Muse is a group of dedicated professional musical artists with relatable, inclusive, universally themed mainly original material that dovetails beautifully with going right into Kundalini mantra Kriya/ chanting. They combine performance art. The most striking element is their authenticity. Really powerful stuff.

performances.title: Bob Keefe and the Surf Renegades
performances.description: he ONLY surf rock band in the Southern Tier
performances.long_description: Bob Keefe and the Surf Renegades is the ONLY surf rock band in the Southern Tier (NY). With the standard quartet lineup of lead and rhythm guitars, bass guitar, and drums, their music is true to the Southern California surf scene of the 1960's.

performances.title: Pete Panek & The Blue Cats
performances.long_description: think: Muddy Waters, Bo Diddley, Hank Williams, Led Zeppelin, Guitar Shorty, Coco Montoya, Son Seals, Koko Taylor, Buddy Guy, Gary Moore, Blind Ebbets Field

performances.title: Mary Lorson
performances.long_description: Lorson‚Äôs words sketch characters and situations in enigmatic glances and flashes of candor, while her graceful melodies promise more consolation than the words they carry.‚Äù

performances.title: Thru Spectrums
performances.long_description: A fixture in the Ithaca, NY, community for years, Thru Spectrums currently plays shows all around New York and the surrounding area. After just releasing their new record, "Process", they have been busy building a steady, loyal fanbase. Catch them live and get down with Ithaca's funkiest crew!

performances.title: Mutron Warriors
performances.long_description: Today the band boasts nine full-time members and has tirelessly crafted its sound to be the live juggernaut that can do it all! The Mutron Warriors continuously leaves audiences wanting more, and keeps them coming back time and time again to share in the experience of a truly energizing show.

performances.title: The Crucials
performances.long_description: Members seen with John Brown's Body, Dispatch, Giant Panda Guerilla Dub Squad, Big Mean Sound Machine, Nahko and Medicine for the People, Thunder Body, Donna the Buffalo, The Comb Down, Galactic Escort Service, Sophistafunk, Road Man, Mosaic Foundation, Jimkata, Xamalian, Sim Redmond Band and more.

performances.title: Rosie and the Bros
performances.long_description: Rose & The Bros are a powerhouse ensemble specializing in irresistible Zydeco and Cajun dance grooves resonating with sweet vocal harmonies and crooning country roots. With a shared dream to simply have a blast while making people dance without stopping, Rosie Newton, Paul Martin, and Steve Selin set out to collect tunes and the rare ingredients of a no holds barred Zydeco and Cajun dance party. Once the trio had found their undeniable rhythm section in drummer Greg Evans, bassist Angelo Peters, and rub board/triangle player Sally Freund, Rose & The Bros became a six piece instant party and the band was complete. Now, Rose & The Bros continue forward, gathering strength and a warm following with infectious joy, a love for community, and a rollicking good time.

performances.title: June with Chandani Belly Dance Troupe Cayuga
performances.long_description: Chandani Belly Dance Troupe performs under the direction of June Seaney, Professional Oriental Dancer. It is made up of women of various ages and backgrounds who come together to share their love and respect of the music and culture of the Middle East and North Africa through Oriental dance, and to share this dance with everyone through performance.

performances.title: Fall Creek Brass Band
performances.long_description: FCBB is exciting, youthful, celebratory, and highly danceable funk, rock, pop, brass, and hip-hop on horns and drums.

performances.title: Mirage Belly Dancers of Ithaca
performances.long_description: We are a multi-generational belly dance troupe originating out of Ithaca's Community School of Music and Arts. The troupe has been in existence for more than 30 years and we're still going strong. Invite us to join your next celebration!

performances.title: Kurt Lichtmann
performances.long_description: [object Object]

performances.title: Hilby the German Juggling Boy
performances.long_description: As a boy growing up in Berlin, young Hilby boasted no traumatic childhood experiences and exhibited no particular talents other than making funny faces at strangers and, as Hilby himself describes it, "breezing rhyzmically." Hilby grew up doing all the fun things that people do when they're not in school until they began to call him a grown-up. That's when he packed up his old kit bag, gave his mom a big kiss on the cheek, and set out on a journey that was to lead him all over the world.

performances.title: Fiddlin' Future
performances.long_description: All of the musicians in the Fiddlin' Future chapter of the NYSOTFA are kids. WIth adult oversight, the staff of this chapter are all kids too. Many of these talented young musicians were inspired to learn to fiddle through attending the annual NYSOTFA sponsored Kids' Kamp held at the North American Fiddlers' Hall of Fame and Museum in Osceola, NY. They have performed at shopping malls, for dances, concerts and at various other fiddling events in New York State. In addition to supporting each other, the kids in this chapter inspire other kids to consider learning to play the fiddle. As the name implies, this chapter truely is the "Fiddlin' Future".

performances.title: Alicia Freedman
performances.long_description: created A Little Lighter and Belly Dance Body & Soul as a way to fuse art and food. A way to make it fun and sensual to take care of ourselves. My dream is that this project touches your life and leaves you feeling lighter, graceful and grateful with every bite and every step.

performances.title: ITHACA Ballet
performances.long_description: The Ithaca Ballet, under the direction of Cindy Reid, is Upstate New York‚Äôs only repertory company and is the resident ballet company at the beautiful State Theatre in downtown Ithaca. Founded in 1961, it is also the oldest continuously performing arts group in Tompkins County. The Ithaca Ballet‚Äôs mission is sharing the art of classical dance with the widest audience possible in upstate New York.

performances.title: Fingerlakes Magic Club/ International Brotherhood of Magicians
performances.long_description: The International Brotherhood of Magicians is the world‚Äôs largest organization of magicians, with members in 88 countries. Founded in 1922 by Len Vintus and Gene Gordon, the I.B.M.‚Äôs membership today includes the top professional magicians and thousands of enthusiastic hobbyists from all walks of life.

performances.title: One Heart Community drumming
performances.description: The drum circle is open to everyone
performances.long_description: One Heart Community Drumming is an open drum circle based in Ithaca, NY, welcoming all ages, levels of interest, and abilities. There is no specific "leader", rather we take turns facilitating the jam. It is helpful to bring your own drum but we usually have extras to share as well as shakers, bells etc.

performances.title: Ithaca Capoeira Center: Angola Quintal
performances.long_description: Capoeira is an Afro-Brazilian martial art, created by slaves and hidden through dance and music. Capoeira is played as a game between two practitioners inside of a circle of spectators, other capoeira players, and a band of musicians.

performances.title: June with Chandani Belly Dance Troupe
performances.long_description: Chandani Belly Dance Troupe performs under the direction of June Seaney, Professional Oriental Dancer. It is made up of women of various ages and backgrounds who come together to share their love and respect of the music and culture of the Middle East and North Africa through Oriental dance, and to share this dance with everyone through performance.

performances.title: Ithaca Karate Harmony with Nature School
performances.long_description: TEACHER DIRECTOR KATHLEEN GARRITY has been teaching karate and self-defense in Ithaca for forty-two years. Garrity studied Washin-ryu karate-do with Master Hidy Ochiai for eighteen years and ran a branch school for Master Ochiai for 15 years. Her dojo, Ithaca Karate Harmony with Nature School, celebrated its 27th anniversary this spring.

performances.title: Hula Hut Polynesian Dance
performances.long_description: Since 2005, our hula group has enjoyed dancing at a variety of private and community events. We look forward to continuing to connect with others in the community as well as teachers/kumu, dancers and halaus/schools from all over the world.

performances.title: Hilby the German Juggling Boy
performances.long_description: As a boy growing up in Berlin, young Hilby boasted no traumatic childhood experiences and exhibited no particular talents other than making funny faces at strangers and, as Hilby himself describes it, "breezing rhyzmically." Hilby grew up doing all the fun things that people do when they're not in school until they began to call him a grown-up. That's when he packed up his old kit bag, gave his mom a big kiss on the cheek, and set out on a journey that was to lead him all over the world.

performances.title: Fall Creek Brass Band
performances.long_description: FCBB is exciting, youthful, celebratory, and highly danceable funk, rock, pop, brass, and hip-hop on horns and drums.
performances.stage: Start at Trolley adn march to Cayuga

performances.title: Danza Romani (Gypsy Dance)
performances.long_description: Danza Romani, directed by June Seaney, performing improvisational Romani (Gypsy) dance from Spain, Turkey and the Balkans. Danza Romani, with traditional costuming, music and dance styling, perform with honor and respect to the Romani people.

performances.title: East Meets West
performances.long_description:
Manmohan Mohapatra is a professional tabla player from Bangalore, India and is staying in Ithaca for a limited time.

This rare type of performance will feature guitarist Dennis Winge (Damodar Das) and Manmohan interacting on a variety of pieces from Western-style jazz, funk and rock to world grooves, odd time signatures and Raga-influenced harmony.

performances.title: Neo Project
performances.description: Funked Up Jazzy Soul, Neo Soul, R&B, Funk, Jazz, Rock, Afro-Caribbean, World Grooves.
performances.long_description: NEO Project is a professional seven piece, high energy dance band rooted in funky R&B grooves, Afro Cuban/Caribbean rhythms & jazzy, bluesy soul music. Its members are music professors, a former Motown sideman and soul practitioners with years of hard earned experience. Their repertoire will get you up and dancing with new arrangements of established hits and irresistible original party grooves. NEO Project is guaranteed to make your event the talk of the town.

performances.title: Mstr McBean
performances.long_description: Mr. McBean is an Ithaca-based rapper, producer and co-founder of our local label, Smacked Records. He‚Äôs most well known in Ithaca as an influential figure in the music and youth scene, having worked alongside community organizations for many years.

performances.title: Anthony Kannon
performances.long_description: Artist from Upstate NY. Smacked Records ü§ôüèº

performances.title: Ave Mack
performances.long_description: Ave Mack was born Rahmel Mack on January 27, in Brooklyn, NY. Ave's childhood in Brooklyn left him wanting more out of his life than what he saw around him. Always interested in music and rhymes, Ave began writing while still young, but thought that a life and career in music was an impossible dream. It wasn't until recent years that he began to realize what he really wanted out of life for himself and for those around him,and began focusing seriously on his music. His lyrical style and content is heavily influenced by his experiences growing up in the Red Hook projects, as well as by the people and friends that he has worked with musically; Trey Skoolz, Dj Dream, TerrorDome, Rising Sun & The GunPoets, Silvaa, Dj Sma,Ra Dollas, Krayze & Hot, Youngin,Willie" Champ" Monroe, Jae Prodigy, Caleo Latin bay, Lil Jay,D-Rock, Eazy Thai Boy, Money Mars,Korey Bolden, Dj Davito, Yung Eddie. Like many of us, Ave Mack is inspired by the career and musical accomplishments of Shawn Carter (Jay-Z), also a Brooklyn native, who struggled with poverty and crime and rejection in the music game before becoming one of the most influential figures in hip hop today. Ave's alias is a reference to both the ave where he grew up in Red Hook, paired with his families government name; representing where he came from by making it a part of who he hopes to become. Ave has performed primarily in upstate NY; his music has been featured on the Tim Westwood Show in the UK and select songs can also be found on mixtapes in New York and Georgia

performances.title: SingTrece
performances.long_description: Elbonee ‚ÄùTrece‚Äù Stevenson has been preparing for stardom since the age of six. Placing her faith in God at an early age, Trece started developing her booming attention grabbing style of vocalizing through constant practice in her church choir. Being chosen one out of five in her school to participate in the School of Performing Arts, she learned a variety of techniques needed to fully exploit her voice. Trece has been trained in Opera, Jazz, Blues, and R&B Music.

performances.title: Mbusi
performances.long_description: Born in south Africa, raised in ny. Mbusi is the truth. Pouring out his life experiences on every track singing with his talented voice. Touching the hearts and minds of every person he comes across. His music can be describe as mesmerizing. And as of late has been described as the r&b king. Take a minute and check out some of our videos..Join the movement of this talented new r&b musician

performances.title: Jamelody
performances.long_description: Michael "Jamelody" Williams was born in Carenage Trinidad in 1980. The baby of six children, it was not long before his parents and older siblings realized that he was a very gifted vocalist and musician. As a member of this very spiritual family it was almost destined that young Michael would be part of the church choir. There, he expanded his vocal ability while embracing his religion. As a teenager he started to apply his vocal skills to making reggae compositions with sweet melodies and hooks in a style very characteristic of the R&B he had been singing earlier in his life but with rich cultural and spiritual content. This is why he took the name "Jamelody" (Jah Melody) It was at a captivating performance as an opening act for a reggae show in Port of Spain which brought him to the attention of his current manager who immediately took him to Jamaica to begin recording. On a second trip to Jamaica he was introduced to Bobby "Digital" Dixon, ace producer and owner of the well known record label Digital B. The sweet sound of Jamelody -- as heard on the single "Pressure", taken from his forthcoming VP album,to be released in September 2007 -- is a result of their amazing collaborative effort and musical chemistry.

performances.title: Drew Kiddoo and the Blackouts
performances.long_description: Drew Kiddoo and the Blackouts is one of those "good ole" country/western bands. Hints of Hank, Merle, and George give every song it's prominent roots influence but the songs remain obviously personal and honest. Drew, from California, moved here in 2017 and began writing original songs about travelin, boozin, and breakin hearts....mostly his own. Backed by local music scene heros: Joe Hayward on banjo/pedal steel (Ithaca Bottom Boys), Seth Gregory on stand-up bass (Mill Bastards/Pine Box), and Sid Burke on fiddle (Mill Bastards/Pine Box), the sound is authentic and timeless. From busking for dollars, to becoming a headlining act, Drew Kiddoo and the Blackouts has recently evolved adding Tristen Ross on mandolin (Ithaca Bottom Boys), Jason Shegogue on electric guitar (Lady D and the Shadow Spirits), Sam Schmidt on second fiddle (Alexander Bradshaw Band), and Kieran Riley on drums (Revel Makes). The band is currently recording its first full length album which will be released in May 2019.

performances.title: Li'l Anne and Hot Cayenne
performances.long_description: Take half a dozen groovemasters, add a spicy blend of rock ‚Äòn‚Äô roll, blues, and funk to the up-tempo Zydeco beat, and presto, you‚Äôve got a dance groove that just won‚Äôt quit! Taking the Northeast Zydeco scene by storm, Li‚Äôl Anne & Hot Cayenne have been invited to play a variety of prestigious venues including the Rhythm and Roots Festival in Charlestown, RI, The Great Connecticut Cajun/Zydeco Music & Arts Festival, and the renowned Saratoga Springs Dance Flurry. In addition, the band has been invited to play venues typically reserved for Louisiana Zydeco bands such as Johnny D‚Äôs in Sommerville, MA, La Belle √âpoque, NYC; the TK Club, Phila., PA and the Somebody Scream Dance Series, Baltimore, MD. Li‚Äôl Anne & Hot Cayenne has also appeared with and provided back-up to Willis Prudhomme and has been invited on stage with Zydeco Force, Sean Ardoin and Zydekool, Leroy Thomas and Roy Carrier

performances.title: Auntie Emo's Ukulele Showcase or Workshop

faq.question: What are the details of the parade?
faq.answer: The Ithaca Festival Parade is one of the city's greatest events every year! Please join us on Friday during Ithaca Festival to celebrate over one hundred community groups participating with costumes, music, dance, and togetherness. We will surely be Celebrating Like It's Our First! The parade will travel south on Cayuga Street from Lincoln Street to Court Street.

faq.question: How do I support the Ithaca Festival?
faq.answer: The Ithaca Festival is crowd sourced. We open applications for performers, food vendors, craft vendors and tablers at the beginning of each year. Stay tuned by checking our website and sign up for our newsletter.

faq.question: Why do I need to buy a button?
faq.answer: Good Question! Your button is your ticket to the festival. While we have many sources of revenue, the festival button is potentially the biggest. It supports Ithaca‚Äôs largest free outdoor music and arts event, performers, staff and all the other expenses that keep it going. This year, we are also offering button benefits including discounts at special deals between May 15th and June 15th at many participating local business as well as some really great prizes! You can find a list of participating businesses on our website. One prize basket will be drawn each day of the festival and our grand prize will be announced on Sunday, June 2 just before our final act takes the stage.

faq.question: How do I enter to win prizes?
Bathroom Locations
Charging Station
EMS
Lost Child
See something, Say something
Lost and Found
Food:
What are the Silent Discos?
faq.answer: Each‚Äã partygoer will get one pair of comfortable, high-quality wireless headphones with independent volume control (in exchange for your I.D so you don't accidentally leave without‚Äã returning the‚Äãm).‚Äã The music will be transmitted from the DJ's equipment‚Äã directly‚Äã to everyone's ears. There will be 3 DJs spinning at all times. Each partygoer will be able to tune into 1 DJ at a time and switch as often as they like, and the color of the lights in the headphones will change accordingly. Find people with the same color lights and boogie to the same groove! Or do the opposite and see how weird you can get!

faq.question: When is it?
faq.answer: See the Ithaca Festival schedule for dates/times/location.

faq.question: Who is playing?
Is there a Facebook event page?
What are the details of the parade?
faq.answer:
The Ithaca Festival Parade is one of the city's greatest events every year! Please join us on Thursday during Ithaca Festival to celebrate over one hundred community groups participating with costumes, music, dance, and togetherness. We will surely be Celebrating Like It's Our First!

5:45pm: Ithaca Youth Bureau Festival Mile 6:30pm: Ithaca Festival Parade The parade will travel south on Cayuga Street from Lincoln Street to Court Street.

faq.question: How else can I get involved?
faq.answer: The Ithaca Festival is crowd sourced. We open applications for performers, food vendors, craft vendors and tablers at the beginning of each year. Stay tuned by checking our website and sign up for our newsletter.

faq.question: What is the price of admission?
faq.answer: The festival is free, though we encourage the purchase of a $5 button to support our event. Some special events may charge additional fees.

faq.question: What are the hours of the festival?
faq.answer:
Ithaca Festival begins at noon on Friday, with the parade occurring at 6:30 that evening. Music, food, crafts, and other activities are open to the public Friday-Sunday for the following hours. Certain special events occur at various locations after hours.

Food Vendors Friday: Noon-10pm Saturday: 11am-10pm Sunday 11am-8pm Craft Vendors Friday Noon-8pm Saturday 10am-8pm Sunday 10am-7pm Music Performances: Friday Noon-10pm Saturday 11am-10pm Sunday 11am-9pm

faq.question: How can I get a schedule of events?
faq.answer:
You can find printed programs at various downtown locations, including Wegmans.

You can also view details about performers here: Performer Schedule Special Ev_x007f_ents

faq.question: Where can I find information about vendors?
faq.answer:
Food Vendors

Participating food vendors can be found along the 100 block of W. MLK Jr. St. between Cayuga and Geneva Streets. Craft Vendors Participating craft vendors can be found along Cayuga St. between Green and Court. The craft fair is organized and managed by the Downtown Ithaca Alliance. For more information, please contact Tatiana Sy at 607-277-8679.

faq.question: Where can I park during the festival?
faq.answer:
There are several parking options in downtown Ithaca during Ithaca Festival, including three nearby parking garages and many metered parking spaces. Parking garages are noted on the Ithaca Festival Map. Neighborhood parking is also available. Walking, biking, using public transportation, and carpooling are highly encouraged.

Parking Garage Fees Friday: $1/hour or $7 for the day Saturday: $5 for the day Sunday: $5 for the day
